CatDescriptText: Mr. Oliver Sherwood, 1509 Celtic Street, Carrick, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: �Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?� answer reads: �I do. I think that they are honest people and therefore the businesses will be run right.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Oliver Sherwood, wearing plaid shirt and light colored sweater with moth hole, standing in front of brick wall with store windows on either side, one on right with female mannequin and sign that reads "St... Cl...S... All Pr... Sa..."
